intro: Mitscherlichia albococcinea, commonly known as the white-capped mitscherlichia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in cooler climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
